description: System Log is 90% full. The System Log has a circular buffer.
The System Log will destroy the oldest half of its entries when
it is 100% full. This alarm is used to notify Management
stations to download the System Log so entries may not be lost.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ADTRAN-TAeSCU-MIB::adTAeSCUSystemLogFull ADTRAN-GENTRAPINFORM-MIB::adTrapInformSeqNum i 9999 SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE ADTRAN-TAeSCU-MIB::adTAeSCUSystemLogPercentFull i 9999

description: The sequence number included in the last trap originated by
this device. This can be used to confirm receipt of the
latest traps. Not needed by SNMPv2 Informs.
variables.name: ADTRAN-GENTRAPINFORM-MIB::adTrapInformSeqNum

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: Percentage of System Log buffer used. When the
System Log is full it will remove the oldest half
of its entries. When the System log is 70% full
it will send a alarm every 5% used so an administration
could upload the system log.
variables.name: ADTRAN-TAeSCU-MIB::adTAeSCUSystemLogPercentFull

description: Invalid user authentication attempts.
The sequence number included in the last trap originated by
this device. This can be used to confirm receipt of the
latest traps. Not needed by SNMPv2 Informs.
variables.name: ADTRAN-GENTRAPINFORM-MIB::adTrapInformSeqNum

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: System Log fails to record an event.

event.Summary: System Log failed to record an event; $v5

node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is

variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: Percentage of System Log buffer used. When the
System Log is full it will remove the oldest half

it will send a alarm every 5% used so an administration

variables.name: ADTRAN-TAeSCU-MIB::adTAeSCUSystemLogPercentFull

description: Number of entries in system log.
variables.name: ADTRAN-TAeSCU-MIB::adTAeSCUSystemLogCount

description: An string description of a system log Failure.
This OID is valid in a SNMP trap.
variables.name: ADTRAN-TAeSCU-MIB::adTAeSCUSystemLogFailureDescription

description: Inactive account expiration notification. Account set to expired.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ADTRAN-TAeSCU-MIB::adTAeSCUSystemInactiveAccountExpiration ADTRAN-GENTRAPINFORM-MIB::adTrapInformSeqNum i 9999 SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE ADTRAN-TAeSCU-MIB::adTAeSCUSecAccountUserID s EXAMPLE ADTRAN-TAeSCU-MIB::adTAeSCUSecAccountAge i 9999

description: The sequence number included in the last trap originated by
this device. This can be used to confirm receipt of the
latest traps. Not needed by SNMPv2 Informs.
variables.name: ADTRAN-GENTRAPINFORM-MIB::adTrapInformSeqNum

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: Security account user ID name. If account
name is zero length (empty) then an account
name can be set. Setting a userID name
creates an account with default properties.
Account names cannot be changed. To change
an account name, the account first have
to be deleted by setting adTAeSCUSecNumAccountLogin
to deleted. Then set to the desired name.
All attempts to change an account name will
generate a bad value error.
variables.name: ADTRAN-TAeSCU-MIB::adTAeSCUSecAccountUserID

description: Security account age.
variables.name: ADTRAN-TAeSCU-MIB::adTAeSCUSecAccountAge
